Uses of Class
javax.swing.plaf.RootPaneUI

Packages that use RootPaneUI
javax.swing Provides a set of "lightweight" (all-Java language) components that, to the maximum degree possible, work the same on all platforms. 
javax.swing.plaf.basic Provides user interface objects built according to the Basic look and feel. 
javax.swing.plaf.metal Provides user interface objects built according to the Java look and feel (once codenamed Metal), which is the default look and feel. 
javax.swing.plaf.multi Provides user interface objects that combine two or more look and feels. 
 

Uses of RootPaneUI in javax.swing
 

Methods in javax.swing that return RootPaneUI
 RootPaneUI JRootPane.getUI()
          Returns the L&F object that renders this component.
 

Methods in javax.swing with parameters of type RootPaneUI
 void JRootPane.setUI(RootPaneUI ui)
          Sets the L&F object that renders this component.
 

Uses of RootPaneUI in javax.swing.plaf.basic
 

Subclasses of RootPaneUI in javax.swing.plaf.basic
 class BasicRootPaneUI
          Basic implementation of RootPaneUI, there is one shared between all JRootPane instances.
 

Uses of RootPaneUI in javax.swing.plaf.metal
 

Subclasses of RootPaneUI in javax.swing.plaf.metal
 class MetalRootPaneUI
          Provides the metal look and feel implementation of RootPaneUI.
 

Uses of RootPaneUI in javax.swing.plaf.multi
 

Subclasses of RootPaneUI in javax.swing.plaf.multi
 class MultiRootPaneUI
          A multiplexing UI used to combine RootPaneUIs.
